Text:
Epsilon is searching for the "Heart's Bounty" to
make a brand new slime suit. With Zeta's guidance,
she has arrived at the Great Ize Shrine where she
expects to find a clue.

Since we're here, let's visit the shrine first to
wish for success in finding the "Heart's Bounty"
rice cake!
Huh...you're really getting into it.

Well, we came all this way—do you have a problem
with that?

We have to go into the shrine's inner sanctum to
make a wish, and besides, there's really no point in
visiting it in the first—

Ahh, I get it. We need to go further in.
Then let's hurry up and go.
She totally just ignored me...

Epsilon heads toward the inner sanctum with Zeta.
However—
What the—?! What's with this long line?!

Yeah, that's usually how it goes. We might as well
get a fortune slip while we wait for the line to die
down.

Really? Can we do that? Don't you usually get a
fortune slip after making a wish?

The money offered to make a wish and the money for
a fortune slip are all the same to the shrine. As long as
you spend money, they're happy. The order doesn't
matter.
Is the Great Shrine really that focused on money?

Who knows? ...Ah, looks like fortune slips are
over there.
H-Hey, wait up Zeta! Don't leave me behind!

Catching up with Zeta, who is already drawing
a fortune, Epsilon follows suit. She slowly opens
the folded slip of paper...
What did you get?
...Ahhh!
You look shook up. Which one you did get?

"Very Bad Luck" ...Huh, so you really can draw one
of these. Well, they say it's best not to take it too
seriously, anyway.
So, what did you get, Zeta?
Oh, me? I got "Very Good Luck."
Wha—?!

Uh, well...we're making a wish next! I'm sure my
luck will change after that... Yep...definitely!
Why is your voice shaking?

It's not shaky! C-C'mon, let's wash our hands and
get in line!

Epsilon gleefully heads over to the fountain to wash
her hands. When she squeezes through the crowd and
reaches toward the water...
Gyah?! Zeta, did you just splash me?!
Don't look at me. I didn't do it.

But, look on the bright side. Now the rest of you
has also been cleansed.
It's not funny!

*sigh*... Is this the bad luck from my fortune slip
manifesting? Enough fooling around, let's get in
line.

Ugh...there are so many people. Like I said,
I'll pass on—
...Huh?! Oh no, my sandal! And at a time like this...!

Ooh, the strap came clean off. Weren't they brand
new?

(Why is all this happening just to me?! It's all
because of that fortune slip!)

Despite the misfortune, Epsilon manages to finally
make it to the shrine's inner sanctum. However...

Th-There's even more people here?! Zeta, what should
we—
...Huh? She's gone?!
Found the offering box. Lucky me.
You already made your wish?! Lucky you, unlike me...

...No, if luck isn't on my side, then...I'll just
have to take matters into my own hands!

(I'll toss this magic-infused coin and guide it into
the offering box! It's a little far, but I can do it!)
(In you go!)

She tosses the coin, and with precision, controls it
so that it falls neatly into the offering box.

(Perfect! Now then... Please, god of the shrine!
I wish to get even closer to Master Shadow this
year!)

Eyes closed, Epsilon makes an honest wish within her
heart.

(Now that I've made my wish, it's time to get down
to business! I'll get my hands on the "Heart's
Bounty" and create the perfect body!)
Hehe, nothing can stop me now!

Oh, you're back to your usual self. Looks like you
were able to make your wish, too.

Yep. No amount of people or bad luck will get
between me and my love for Master Shadow.

Then, why not let go of that fortune slip? You can
tie it to that tree over there.
I'll do that. So long, bad luck... Huh?
What's wrong?

Now that I've taken a closer look, there's something
written in fine print under "Very Bad Luck"...

Let's see... It says, "Very Bad Luck can be
improved with effort"...

Oh, so it wasn't a bad fortune after all.
...Hm? Epsilon?
Don't... Don't you think I know thaaat?!

Epsilon's infuriated voice echoes throughout the
bustling shrine.
